intro: Haplopappus longipes, commonly known as the longstem pappus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and are followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds.
